editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: Images 4r-10l: Computus charts. Images 11r-42r: Gospel of John, arranged by sections for prayer. Images 42r-43l: Sword of Divinity, Säyfä Mäläkot, ሠይፈ፡ መለኮት፡, AbbCat 171, , Notice 104; AbbCat 186, , Notice 233; StrLin 47, f.88v; EMML 1169, . Images 43r-150l Psalter. The midpoint (Image 87) is unmarked. Psalm 151 is the short version. The fourth canticles identifes Hana as prophetess. The Song of Songs contains the Scholars edition lines. Praises of Mary begins with Monday and culminates on Sunday. Images 150l-152r: Prayer of the Covenant, Ṣälotä Kidan, ጸሎተ፡ ኪዳን፡. Images 152r-159l: Anaphora of Our Lady Mary attributed to Cyriacus of Bəhənsa, Qǝddase Maryam Gwäs’a, ቅዳሴ፡ ማርያም፡. Images 159l-160r: Absolution of the Son, Fǝtḥat zä-Wäld. ፍትሐት፡ ዘወልድ፡. As part of the liturgy, this prayer has been copied and printed many times, e.g. MD 640–4; MQ 23–5; Liturgy 31–3. Images 160r-161l: Collection of asmat prayers. In a double-slip mahdar. Image 11r mentions the owner, ዘጊዮርጊስ.

revisionDesc.change: Created XML record from EMIP Collection Metadata.xsls
